results.title: The Scarlet pimpernel [Grant]
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, London Film Productions, A&E Television Networks, Julian Murphy, Edward Bennett and Patrick Lau
results.brief_description: France, 1793 and the terror of the French Revolution is at it’s height. Every day the tumbrils roll more innocent people to their deaths under the guillotine, but there is one man who dares to defy the revolutionaries; The Scarlet Pimpernel. Richard E. Grant plays the foppish English aristocrat Sir Percy Blakeney, a cad with a passion only for society and clothes but who leads a daring and exciting double life - as the Scarlet Pimpernel. This vibrant three part series is full of murder, double dealing, intrigue and passion that will keep you in suspense until the very end. Cast includes the beautiful Elizabeth McGovern as Lady Blakeney and Martin Shaw as the evil, self-centered, Chauvelin, right hand man of Robspierre.

results.title: The Scarecrow
results.creator_credit: Oasis Films, New Zealand National Film Unit, Rob Whitehouse and Sam Pillsbury
results.brief_description: Set in post war small town New Zealand, “The Scarecrow” is a suspenseful tale told through the eyes of adolescent Ned (Jonathan Smith). He and his friend Les (Daniel McLaren) become involved in the diabolical actions of the Scarecrow (John Carradine). With several mysterious deaths and near misses, the story reaches a climax, only to leave the audience with an unexpected finale. Based on a novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson, “The Scarecrow” is the feature debut of director Sam Pillsbury. The film is full of telling and often comic details of life in the small community. Gothic elements are highlighted by the presence of the Scarecrow and insistence upon the eccentric. Cast also includes Tracy Mann.

results.title: The Scarab mechanical horse
results.creator_credit: Gate Film Production and Gordon O'Connell
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the special advances in modern industry and communication of the Scarab Mechanical Horse, a three-wheeled traction united designed to tow a variety of trailers. Shows the ingenious automatic coupling mechanism which joins traction unit and trailer, and how swift interchangeability can be completed by only one man. Gives examples of it use in road services, railway yards, municipal cleansing and other functions.

results.creator_credit: Eltham Films, Patrick Ryan and Tim Burstall

Not to be outdone, Sebastian sneaks more sausages while the tramp is not looking and runs happily away into the bush.

results.title: The Santhia story
results.brief_description: The “Santhia” after a disastrous fire sank in the Hooghly River, India, where she lay untouched in the mud for two years. She was only nineteen feet from the wharf and was a menace to shipping. Captain J. P. Williams of the United Salvage Pty Ltd was given the task of raising her. The film shows the whole of the salvage operations and illustrates the various stages by diagrams. The divers go down into the thick mud of the fast-moving river to reconnoitre. They place pressure jets for bringing up the mud, place electrically fired explosive charges for removing the superstructures. Finally, the hull is raised by huge cranes and cleaned and towed away to be broken up by ship-wreckers. The whole salvage operation took nine months. From the series “Epics of salvage”.

results.title: The Sand castle = Le Chateau de sable
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Moretti, Gaston Sarault and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: A fable of great humor and appeal, The Sand Castle is the story of the Sandman and the creatures he sculpts out of sand. Under his direction, they build a castle and celebrate the completion of their new home, only to be interrupted by an uninvited guest. The wind blows, and the castle crumbles. The filmmaker leaves the door open to various interpretations. Sound film without words.

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 8 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Senkoska Film Company, Nishimura Shun-ichi and Sadao Funatoko
results.brief_description: Japanese television show from the 1960s, “The Samurai”, set in 17th century medieval Japan, is about the fortunes of Shintaro, a master swordsman and samurai. His eternal quest is to hunt down his enemies, namely ninjas, who dress in black and are armed with a diverse array of weapons as well as being schooled in the art of hypnotic illusion. This tape, Volume eight, consists of four episodes. “Dogan the Master ninja”: Only eighty miles separates Lord Sadanobu from his destination. Of the original ten, six of the Iga ninja have died. To assist the remaining ninjas Momocki Genkuro attempts to recruit a fearsome ninja, Dogan, the master of Iga ninja. “The Stolen case”: Shintaro requests the assistance of Dogan’s pupils as does Genkuro. Genjuro convinces Dogan that Shintaro is guilty of murder. “Wolf ninja”: The three pupils of Dogan join Shintaro. Genkuro recruits the Wolf ninjas to assist his attacks on Sadanobu. “The Last duel”: Genkuro has one last chance to stop Sadanobu from reaching Kyoto. The ninjas, and their respective leaders, face each other in an almighty showdown. Authentic locations, inventive kung fu action and a wonderful score make “The Samurai” an imaginative and fun action series, a clever combination of martial arts, swordplay and magic in a historical setting. Cast includes Koichi Ose and Fuyukichi Maki; original music by Hiroki Ogawa; written by Masaru Igami and Yasushi Kato. Please note, dubbed into English.
